holidays.name: Pack Your Lunch Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the art of packing your own lunch, encouraging creativity, saving money, and enjoying homemade meals.
holidays.origin: An unofficial observance that gained popularity through social media and workplace wellness initiatives, promoting healthy eating habits and reducing waste.
holidays.funFact: Packing your lunch can save you over $1,000 a year compared to eating out! Plus, you get to be the lunch boss of your own flavor kingdom.

holidays.name: Mario Day
holidays.description: A celebration of everyone's favorite Italian plumber, Mario, from the iconic Nintendo video games.
holidays.origin: Played off the abbreviation of March 10 as 'Mar10' resembling 'Mario', the day is embraced by fans worldwide as a tribute to the gaming icon who first appeared in 1981.
holidays.funFact: Mario was originally called 'Jumpman' in his first video game appearance before getting his now-famous name.

holidays.name: Middle Name Pride Day
holidays.description: A quirky holiday encouraging people to embrace and appreciate their middle names, often neglected but full of personality and family history.
holidays.origin: Started as a social media challenge to share and celebrate the uniqueness behind middle names and stories attached to them.
holidays.funFact: Some famous people use their middle names as their public stage names, like Samuel Langhorne Clemens, better known as Mark Twain!

holidays.name: International Bagpipe Day
holidays.description: A day to honor the unique sound and cultural heritage of the bagpipes, often associated with Scotland but celebrated worldwide.
holidays.origin: Created by the Bagpipe Society to raise awareness and appreciation of bagpipe music in all its forms.
holidays.funFact: Despite being linked mostly with Scotland, bagpipes date back thousands of years and various types exist worldwide, from Spain to North Africa!
